title: On the Relation Between the Median and the Maximum Common Subgraph of a Set of Graphs

author: Miquel Ferrer, Autonomous University of Barcelona

segmentation: So good afternoon to everyone.
My name is Miguel Ferrer.
I'm a PhD student at a computer vision center in Barcelona and I'm going to briefly explain our work on the relation between the median and the maximum common subgraph of a set of graphs.
So we are interested in the computation of the generalized median graph.
Median graphs can be used to compute are representative of a set of process and therefore can be useful to simplify in somehow some classification process.
So the definition of the generalized median graphs is as follows.
Suppose you have a certain levels for.
Notes and edges.
You can construct all the graphs having this labels and given a subset of this world set of graphs.
The median graph is defined as the set.
Sorry, the graph inset which has the smallest sum of distances to all the graphs in NS.
This term here is called the sum of distances, so the computation of the generalized median graph is a hard task and some theoretical properties have been shown in the past.
One of them relates the sum of distance of the generalized median graph.

To some graphs in the in the set, in this case, in the general case, the bounds for the sum of distances for the generalized median graphs falls in this limits where G angio are the empty and the Union graph of S&P is a partition of office, and it could be interesting to try to reduce.
This abounds in order to.
Improve the computation of the.

Median graphs, So what we're proposing in this work is concretely the reduction in the upper bone for the sum of distances of the median graph based on a particular cost function, which leads to distance between graphs related to the Maxim common subgraph between them.
So we show that given a set of graphs and the maximum comments graph, all of them, the sum of distances of the median graph falls.
In between these these limits, this new upper bound can help us in the.
To improve the existing algorithms and then to get some results of better results in the competition of this realized meeting graph.
So that's all thank you.
